articles.description: WINSTON — Zoos give ticket holders a front row seat to the wild. What isn’t covered with the fair however is the complex web of factors maintaining the organization — from financials to conservation, there’s more beyond the enclosures.
articles.title: Accreditation matters: Wildlife Safari steps up amid game park crisis

articles.author: Dr. Rachel Pokrandt President and CEO at Umpqua Community College
articles.description: If you’ve driven north of exit 129 lately, you’ve seen it: Umpqua Community College’s bold new billboard, featuring a proud Riverhawk graduate and a single word -“Unstoppable.” That’s not just a slogan. It’s a mindset. It’s a promise we make…
articles.title: Unstoppable: The Class of 2025

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: During her freshman year at Roseburg High School, Emily Gibbons said she only passed three of her 14 classes.
articles.title: From truancy to tattooing: Emily Gibbons finds a path

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: It wasn’t until junior year that Scotlynn Winter realized she actually wouldn’t be graduating Roseburg High School alongside her peers in the class of 2025 if she continued her habits.
articles.title: Just stick it out: Scotlynn Winter changes her tune in time to graduate

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: Phoenix School of Roseburg will host graduation at 6 p.m. Tuesday, June 10, at Jacoby Auditorium at Umpqua Community College, 1140 Umpqua College Road, Winchester.
articles.title: Phoenix School of Roseburg

articles.description: Roseburg High School will host its graduation ceremony at 11 a.m. Saturday, June 7, at Finlay Field at Roseburg High School, 400 W. Harvard Avenue in Roseburg.

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: Yoncalla High School will host their graduation ceremony at 6:30 p.m. Friday, May 30, at the Yoncalla High School gymnasium, 292 Fifth St., Yoncalla.

articles.author: Maggie Dapp The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — A summer book sale will be held in the Ford Room of the Roseburg Public Library by the Friends of the Roseburg Public Library June 5-7.
articles.title: Summer book sale to be held at Roseburg Public Library

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: MYRTLE CREEK — For Trevor Sharon, video games aren’t just an opportunity to relax on your own, but a chance to connect with those around you.
articles.title: The Vault Entertainment Center to bring retro arcade fun to Myrtle Creek

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: CAMAS VALLEY — For rural fire departments, especially volunteer ones, funding and resources can be a challenge. Fortunately for the Camas Valley Rural Volunteer Fire District (CVRVFD), a $30,000 grant is enabling it to expand and improve services.
articles.title: Camas Valley Rural Volunteer Fire District receives $30,000 grant, plans to construct substation

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — The online open house is live for residents to give feedback on transportation in Roseburg, specifically the Interstate 5 exits 124 and 125.
articles.title: Comment on solutions for Interstate 5 exits in Roseburg

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: OREGON — As Wildfire Awareness Month comes to a close, the Oregon Department of Emergency Management is urging residents to take action now to prepare for the upcoming wildfire season by being ready to evacuate.
articles.title: OEM urges for wildfire readiness

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — A city release said along with Body Balance Yoga Center Director Alli Spooner and other instructors, free yoga sessions will be held in a tranquil setting in Stewart Park. This will take place east of the of the…
articles.title: Yoga in the Park begins in July

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: While the first image people have of firefighting may be first responders in bunker gear charging into buildings engulfed in flames, it’s certainly not the only thing firefighters do. In fact, it’s not even the most common situation they face.
articles.title: Preparing to save lives: UCC hosts car accident rescue class in Roseburg

articles.author: Maggie Dapp The News-Review
articles.description: REEDSPORT — When 15 year old Taylor Sharrai heads into work — after a full day of school and her year round sports practices — she walks in alongside colleagues several decades her senior.
articles.title: 15-year-old Taylor Sharrai named student councilor in Reedsport

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: War stories aren’t always told through words; They can be told through a badge, a photograph, a bloodstained tear on a uniform. Over Memorial Day Weekend, visitors to the Roseburg Memorial Gardens were able to experience history in this way…
articles.title: Not forgotten: Military uniforms exhibit displayed at Roseburg Memorial Gardens for Memorial Day

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: Over Memorial Day Weekend, airplanes whizzed through the skies above the Roseburg Regional Airport, engaging in complex aerobatics, high-speed races and even head-to-head aerial combat. Well, miniature airplanes that is.
articles.title: 52nd Northwest Control-Line Regionals bring aerial acrobatics to Roseburg.

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: Speaking to the crowd Monday at the Memorial Day Tribute, Oregon National Guard Colonel Paul Dyer said the word of the day was purpose.
articles.title: Living with purpose: Roseburg hosts Memorial Day ceremonies to remember the fallen

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg is expected to hit near 90 degrees Friday - making it the hottest day of 2025 so far. The National Weather Service says highs will be 15 - 20 degrees above normal. A gradual cooldown is expected over the weekend.
articles.title: Roseburg Set to See Hottest Day of 2025 So Far Today

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Dawna Zarbano, a trusted voice in Douglas County for 22 years, retired today after 34 years of service. Known to first responders and the public alike, she signed off with a heartfelt final message, closing a remarkable career in emergency communications.
articles.title: Beloved Longtime Voice of Douglas County Retires After 34 Years of Service

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A couple from Drain was found deceased after their SUV rolled down a steep slope in the Tyee area. The crash site was located behind a locked Weyerhaeuser gate. Authorities say alcohol may have been a factor, and neither victim was wearing a seatbelt.
articles.title: Drain Couple Found Deceased After SUV Crash in Remote Tyee Area

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Douglas County fire officials say fire season could arrive by early June due to dry conditions. Despite concerns over federal staffing, local crews are well-prepared, with strong recruitment and interagency coordination already in place.
articles.title: Douglas County Officials Prepare for Early Start to Fire Season

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: West Coast Game Park owner Brian Tenney was arrested on drug charges after authorities found meth, cocaine, firearms - including a modified machine gun - and $1.6 million during a multi-agency investigation. Over 300 animals were previously seized from the facility.
articles.title: West Coast Game Park Owner Arrested on Drug Charges Amid Ongoing Investigation
